  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFICATED PERSONNEL INFORMED OF DISTRESSED PACKAGE. SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW, NOTED LIQUID RELEASE CONTAINED TO PACKAGE. DISTRESSED PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: THE TWIST TURN CAP WAS LOOSE WHICH ALLOWED LEAKAGE TO HAPPEN DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: CAP WAS TIGHTENED TO MITIGATE FURTHER SPILLAGE

item.title: Report E-2024030433
item.description:
Report E-2024030433

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 14, 2024, two (2) 55-gallon drums of UN3098 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized duct tape to patch the damaged drums to prevent additional release. TLE crews collected and containerized the damaged drums into two (2) 95-gallon overpack drums for disposal purposes. Soda ash was deployed worked in with hand tools. A granular absorbent and a degreasing agent were deployed and worked in with hand tools. All undamaged cargo was wiped with absorbent pads to remove any residual product and repalletized for continued processing and shipping. All impacted materials were collected and containerized in one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal purposes. Soda ash was deployed to neutralize the impacted outside the concrete ground and worked in with hand tools. All impacted materials were collected and containerized in one (1) additional 35-gallon drum for disposal purposes.

item.title: Report E-2024030432
item.description:
Report E-2024030432

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 13, 2024, one (!) 275-gallon tote of UN3266 was punctured in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums. FCE personnel transferred the product from damaged tote into a new one to be shipped off to its destination.

item.title: Report X-2024030713
item.description:
Report X-2024030713

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was placed in a pick up location to be loaded into a trailer to continue heading towards its destination. Package was found leaking by a package handler who would have taken it to the load end. Package was left at pickup area to be handled by certified hazmat personnel. Proceeded to collect package with proper PPE for the substance. DescribePack: Package seal leaked, causing isopropanol liquids to leak from wipe containers. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was removed from original container and was relocated to a salvage drum.

item.title: Report E-2024030393
item.description:
Report E-2024030393

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 13, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1903 was damaged by falling freight and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN1903-impacted trailer and concrete. All impacted material was collected and containerized into three (3) 35-gallon drums and the patched tote was placed on a spill pallet. All waste was staged in the R+L heat room for transport and disposal. The crew returned the next day to perform a tote transfer. TLE personnel transferred the product from the damaged 330-gallon tote into a new 375-gallon tote to be shipped off to its destination. The generated waste from the transfer was collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum. All waste and the damaged tote was staged in the R+L heat room for transport and disposal.

Report X-2024021665

  • Carrier/Reporter: Norfolk Southern
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Norfolk Southern personnel reported a hiss coming from top of GATX 212015 Employees cleared area by 330 feet per ERG NS HazMat notified and Dispatched Contractor (SPSI) Investigation found Vapor line valve 1/4 turn open with closure plug not installed. The valve was closed and the closure plug was installed tool tight.

item.title: Report E-2024020474
item.description:
Report E-2024020474

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-27
  • City: MACEDONIA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LOGISTICS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling northbound on Route 8 and was attempting to take the ramp onto I 271 North. For unknown reasons, the KAG Energy, LLC driver lost control of the unit and and went off the overpass. The tractor and trailer were immediately engulfed in fire. 7497 gallons of diesel fuel being hauled on the trailer was lost. A nearby creek was impacted by the spilled diesel fuel. Hepaco Environmental and Atlas Environmental were dispatched to the scene and continue to remediate the release.
